page.title: 05School Changes
page.content: School Changes. The school was built in 1874 near the church. It is not a church school now. The first head was called Mr Masters. His wife taught the infants and they lived in the school house. During World War Two the school was very overcrowded with children from the airforce camp. When the displaced people moved on the school population returned to normal, and since the war has sometimes fallen so low that the school has been threatened with closure. In 1983 children from Allostock school transferred to Byley when Allostock school closed. The school has since been modernised and extended to include the school house as a teaching area, and its future should be secure.
